servlets

Class WebServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • servlets.WebServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig

    public class WebServlet
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
    This servlet deals with interactions between the web interface and the social web
    Author:
    Luke Heavens & Ben Carr
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • doPost

        protected void doPost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
          javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
               throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                      java.io.IOException
        When the servlet receives a post request, it looks for and examines a requestId parameter. This determines the appropriate action to take. A JSON object is constructed which is communicated through the response containing relevant data
        Overrides:
        doPost in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:

      • tweetFormRequest

        private java.lang.String tweetFormRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
                                   throws FatalInternalException
        Performs a twitter query using request data and returns tweets and their Ids in the form of a JSON string Saves examined data in the system database in a background thread

        - JSON string
